summary: Three transitive dependencies in the Rust bridge have known vulnerabilities: a critical TOCTOU race condition in remove_dir_all (9.1 CVSS), and two high-severity issues in webpki and hyper affecting certificate verification and HTTP/2 handling. However, this issue was applicable to a previous SDK version and is no longer relevant after the SDK rewrite.
userImpact: Users of older SDK versions could be exposed to critical and high-severity vulnerabilities including arbitrary file deletion and denial of service attacks through malicious inputs.
rootCause: Outdated versions of transitive Rust dependencies (remove_dir_all 0.5.3, webpki 0.22.0, hyper 0.14.23) with known security issues
proposedFix: Upgrade remove_dir_all to 0.8.0 or later, webpki to 0.22.2 or later, and hyper to a patched version
resolutionDetails: Resolved by SDK rewrite/refresh which is no longer applicable to the current version
keyQuote: The SDK is undergoing a rewrite/refresh and this issue applied to a previous version and is no longer applicable
